Thank you very much, this is really helpful. I have another question about =
this: suppose that the crawler visits the page pointed by 

http://foo.com/=
page.php?param=3Dbar

will it try to visit the page 

http://foo.com/page.p=
hp?param=3Dfoobar

? That is: will it try to replace the parameters with ra=
ndom ones? Or an URI is crawled only if it appears in another page? I know =
this might seem a rather strange question, however I have this doubt

Thank=
 you

Matteo


--- In archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com, Noah Levitt  wrote:
=
>
> Hello Matteo,
> 
> Heritrix transforms urls into a canonical form to ch=
eck whether they have already been seen. For example, these urls are all di=
fferent by default:
> 
> http://foo.com/page.php?parameter=3Dbar
> http://f=
oo.com/page.php?parameter=3Dbaz
> http://foo.com/page.php?param=3Dbar
> 
> =
But these are considered equivalent:
> 
> http://foo.com/page.php?x=3Dbar&y=
=3Dbaz
> http://foo.com/page.php?y=3Dbaz&x=3Dbar
> 
> Hope that gives you a=
n idea.
> 
> The rules are customizable as well. There is more information =
here: https://webarchive.jira.com/wiki/display/Heritrix/URI+Canonicalizatio=
n+Rules
> 
> Noah
> 
> 
> 
> On 02/01/2013 03:36 AM, matteo.ceccarello@... =
wrote:
> > Hi all,
> >
> > I can't understand how Heritrix 3 handles pages =
with dynamic content. For example if we have a page pointed by the URL
> >
=
> > http://foo.com/page.php?parameter=3Dbar
> >
> > does Heritrix tries to =
visit the same url with different parameters?
> >
> > I couldn't find the d=
ocumentation about this. Can someone point me out the documentation or give=
 me some clarifications please?
> >
> > Thank you very much!
> >
> > Matteo=

> >
